alert.note: Alert for Monroe (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 9:41AM EST until December 18 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Brodhead Creek At Minisink Hills affecting Monroe County. For the Brodhead Creek...including Minisink Hills...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Brodhead Creek at Minisink Hills. * WHEN...From this afternoon to this evening. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Street flooding begins north of Stoudsburg. At 10.0 feet, Adjacent parks and greenways flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:01 AM EST Monday the stage was 9.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 10.0 feet this afternoon. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.6 feet on 10/08/2005. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (7 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Stg Time Date Brodhead Creek Minisink Hills 10.0 9.6 Mon 9 am 7.0 5.3 10.0 1pm 12/18 &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this evening at 700 PM EST.
